name: photovoltaic laminate production, CdTe | photovoltaic laminate, CdTe | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3505/documentation

Integrated production of photovoltaic thin film modules in a single continuous assembly line process that consists of three steps: semiconductor deposition, cell definition, and module finishing. The bill of material inputs and auxiliary material as well as energy and water needed for the production of the modules are considered. Tap water is purchased and purified to ultrapure water within First Solar's manufacturing facilities, with the electricity usage for purification included in the life cycle inventory. Material losses during module manufacturing have been taken into account.  The amounts of waste, wastewater, direct airborne stack emissions, and emissions to water after on-site wastewater treatment are also taken into account.  The modules produced at First Solar have a size of 2.47m2. The weight is 34.5kg. The efficiency is 17.6%. The rated nominal power is about 435Wp per module.  ;;Emissions and energy requirements of internal recycling are considered. The main output of "glass cullet, sorted" of the recycling process is added as By-Product as this is not reused internally.;;This dataset represents a weighted average by production volume of local First Solar producers.  In 2020, First Solar accounted for >95% of global CdTe PV production.

The activity starts with the reception of the raw materials at the factory gate and describes module production through a continuous assembly line process that consists of three steps: semiconductor deposition, cell definition, and module finishing.


The process ends with the production of the panel and includes the consumption of electricity and heat use, materials, infrastructure, disposal of wastes, and emissions to air and water.
category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/261:Manufacture of electronic components and boards/2610:Manufacture of electronic components and boards

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Global average weighted by production volume of local First Solar producers.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Production technology of thin film cells. Sublimation of the powders and condensation of the vapours on a glass substrate by vapour transport deposition (VTD).;In the first step, float glass is fed into the continuous assembly line followed by vapor transport deposition of semiconductor and recrystallization treatment.  In the second step, laser scribing is applied to separate the semiconductor film into solar cells and back contact metals are deposited. In the third step, busbar, back glass, encapsulant, junction box, aluminum frame, and product label are applied to create a finished product.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Global average weighted by production volume based on First Solar production data only.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Producer information and literature data based on producer information.

flow.name: photovoltaic laminate, CdTe
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/261:Manufacture of electronic components and boards/2610:Manufacture of electronic components and boards
